text.section: In this section, "county" includes Baltimore City.

A request for Partnership funding may be submitted to the Department by:
The governing body of a county; or
The governing body of more than one county.

A request for Partnership funding shall be made in accordance with a schedule and format determined by the Department, in consultation with the Task Force to Study Increasing the Availability of Substance Abuse Programs.

section.section: After consulting with the Task Force to Study Increasing the Availability of Substance Abuse Programs, the Department shall award Partnership funding following the considerations in this section.
Except as provided in subparagraph (ii) of this paragraph, a county granted funding shall be responsible for one-half of the cost of the approved partnership.

The Department may award Partnership funding that results in a county being responsible for less than one-half of the cost of the approved partnership after considering:
The financial hardship of the participating county;
Prior contributions of funds for substance abuse treatment programs made by the participating county; or
Other relevant considerations deemed appropriate by the Department.

A participating county:
May use Partnership funds only to supplement levels of spending by the participating county on drug treatment programs; and
May not use Partnership funds to supplant spending by the participating county on drug treatment programs.
